rule.name: AvoidAxisNavigation
rule.message: Axis navigation has the largest impact when writing an XPath query.
rule.description: Avoid using the 'following' or 'preceeding' axes whenever possible, as these can cut through 100% of the document in the worst case. Also, try to avoid using 'descendant' or 'descendant-self' axes, as if you're at the top of the Document, it necessarily means cutting through 100% of the document.

property.name: xpath
property.value: //node()[ contains(@select,'preceeding::') or contains(@select,'following::') or contains(@select,'descendant::') or contains(@select,'descendant-self::') or ( ($checkSelfDescendantAbreviation = 'true' ) and contains(@select,'//') ) ]

property.name: checkSelfDescendantAbreviation
property.description: descendant::self abreviation, '//', will also trigger this rule.
